items.title: New GlassWorm malware wave targets Macs with trojanized crypto wallets

objects.name: GlassWorm
objects.description: A malware campaign targeting macOS developers using malicious VSCode/OpenVSX extensions and trojanized crypto wallets.
evidence: A fourth wave of the 'GlassWorm' campaign is targeting macOS developers

objects.name: studio-velte-distributor.pro-svelte-extension
objects.description: A malicious OpenVSX extension containing an encrypted payload used by GlassWorm.
evidence: embedded in compiled JavaScript in the OpenVSX extensions

objects.name: cudra-production.vsce-prettier-pro
objects.description: A malicious OpenVSX extension containing an encrypted payload used by GlassWorm.
evidence: embedded in compiled JavaScript in the OpenVSX extensions

objects.name: Puccin-development.full-access-catppuccin-pro-extension
objects.description: A malicious OpenVSX extension containing an encrypted payload used by GlassWorm.
evidence: embedded in compiled JavaScript in the OpenVSX extensions

objects.name: Solana blockchain
objects.description: Blockchain infrastructure used by GlassWorm for command-and-control (C2) mechanisms.
evidence: The Solana blockchain-based command-and-control (C2) mechanism remains unchanged

objects.name: LaunchAgents
objects.description: A macOS persistence mechanism abused by GlassWorm to maintain access.
evidence: instead of Registry modification, it uses LaunchAgents for persistence

objects.name: AppleScript
objects.description: Scripting language used by GlassWorm for execution on macOS systems.
evidence: Instead of PowerShell, it now uses AppleScript

items.notes: No specific IP, Domain, or Hash indicators were present in the text, only software/extension names.
